intro: Oxyceros pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered oxyceros, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Oxyceros pauciflorus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
